      • unsetTagSyntax

        public void unsetTagSyntax()
        Resets the setting value as if it was never set (but it doesn't affect the value inherited from another ParsingConfiguration).

      • getTagSyntax

        public TagSyntax getTagSyntax()
        Description copied from interface: ParsingConfiguration
        Determines the syntax of the template files (angle bracket VS square bracket) that has no #ftl in it. The tagSyntax parameter must be one of:
        • TagSyntax.AUTO_DETECT: use the syntax of the first FreeMarker tag (can be anything, like #list, #include, user defined, etc.)
        • TagSyntax.ANGLE_BRACKET: use the angle bracket syntax (the normal syntax)
        • TagSyntax.SQUARE_BRACKET: use the square bracket syntax

        In FreeMarker 2.3.x TagSyntax.ANGLE_BRACKET is the default for better backward compatibility. Starting from 2.4.x TagSyntax.AUTO_DETECT is the default, so it's recommended to use that even for 2.3.x.

        This setting is ignored for the templates that have ftl directive in it. For those templates the syntax used for the ftl directive determines the syntax.

        Specified by:
        getTagSyntax in interface ParsingConfiguration

      • getDefaultTagSyntax

        protected abstract TagSyntax getDefaultTagSyntax()

      • getOutputFormat

        public OutputFormat getOutputFormat()
        Description copied from interface: ParsingConfiguration
        The output format to use, which among others influences auto-escaping (see ParsingConfiguration.getAutoEscapingPolicy() autoEscapingPolicy}), and possibly the MIME type of the output.

        On the Configuration level, usually, you should leave this on its default, which is UndefinedOutputFormat.INSTANCE, and then use standard file extensions like "ftlh" (for HTML) or "ftlx" (for XML) (and ensure that recognizeStandardFileExtensions is true; see more there). Where you can't use the standard extensions, templates still can be associated to output formats with patterns matching their name (their path) using the templateConfigurations setting of the Configuration. But if all templates will have the same output format, you may set the outputFormat setting of the Configuration after all, to a value like HTMLOutputFormat.INSTANCE, XMLOutputFormat.INSTANCE, etc. Also note that templates can specify their own output format like <#ftl output_format="HTML">, which overrides any configuration settings.

        Specified by:
        getOutputFormat in interface ParsingConfiguration
        See Also:
        Configuration.getRegisteredCustomOutputFormats(), Configuration.getTemplateConfigurations(), ParsingConfiguration.getRecognizeStandardFileExtensions(), ParsingConfiguration.getAutoEscapingPolicy()

      • getSourceEncoding

        public Charset getSourceEncoding()
        Description copied from interface: ParsingConfiguration
        Sets the charset used for decoding template files.

        Defaults to the default system fileEncoding, which can change from one server to another, so you should always set this setting. If you don't know what charset your should chose, "UTF-8" is usually a good choice.

        When a project contains groups (like folders) of template files where the groups use different encodings, consider using the templateConfigurations setting on the Configuration level.

        Individual templates may specify their own charset by starting with <#ftl sourceEncoding="...">. However, before that's detected, at least part of template must be decoded with some charset first, so this setting (and templateConfigurations) still have role.

        Specified by:
        getSourceEncoding in interface ParsingConfiguration

      • getDefaultSourceEncoding

        protected abstract Charset getDefaultSourceEncoding()
        Returns the value the getter method returns when the setting is not set, possibly by inheriting the setting value from another ParsingConfiguration, or throws CoreSettingValueNotSetException.

      • setSourceEncoding

        public void setSourceEncoding(Charset sourceEncoding)
        The charset to be used when reading the template "file" that the TemplateLoader returns as binary (InputStream). If the #ftl header specifies an charset, that will override this.

      • sourceEncoding

        public SelfT sourceEncoding(Charset sourceEncoding)
        Fluent API equivalent of setSourceEncoding(Charset)

      • unsetSourceEncoding

        public void unsetSourceEncoding()
        Resets the setting value as if it was never set (but it doesn't affect the value inherited from another ParsingConfiguration).

      • isSourceEncodingSet

        public boolean isSourceEncodingSet()
        Description copied from interface: ParsingConfiguration
        Tells if this setting is set directly in this object. If not, then depending on the implementing class, reading the setting might returns a default value, or returns the value of the setting from a parent parsing configuration or throws a CoreSettingValueNotSetException.
        Specified by:
        isSourceEncodingSet in interface ParsingConfiguration

      • setTabSize

        public void setTabSize(int tabSize)
        Setter pair of getTabSize().

      • tabSize

        public SelfT tabSize(int tabSize)
        Fluent API equivalent of setTabSize(int)

      • unsetTabSize

        public void unsetTabSize()
        Resets the setting value as if it was never set (but it doesn't affect the value inherited from another ParsingConfiguration).

      • getTabSize

        public int getTabSize()
        Description copied from interface: ParsingConfiguration
        The assumed display width of the tab character (ASCII 9), which influences the column number shown in error messages (or the column number you get through other API-s). So for example if the users edit templates in an editor where the tab width is set to 4, you should set this to 4 so that the column numbers printed by FreeMarker will match the column number shown in the editor. This setting doesn't affect the output of templates, as a tab in the template will remain a tab in the output too. It's value is at least 1, at most 256.
        Specified by:
        getTabSize in interface ParsingConfiguration

      • getDefaultTabSize

        protected abstract int getDefaultTabSize()
        Returns the value the getter method returns when the setting is not set, possibly by inheriting the setting value from another ParsingConfiguration, or throws CoreSettingValueNotSetException.

      • isTabSizeSet

        public boolean isTabSizeSet()
        Tells if this setting is set directly in this object or its value is inherited from the parent parsing configuration..
        Specified by:
        isTabSizeSet in interface ParsingConfiguration
